summaryOfNewsArticle: In a brazen daylight robbery at the Louvre museum in Paris, French police discovered that eight valuable jewels, including pieces from Empress Eugénie’s tiara, were stolen by a highly professional and likely organized crime group. Experts believe the items were broken down into smaller parts to be sold for a fraction of their value, with the gold and gems melted or cut into smaller stones. The heist is suspected to be linked to money laundering operations, and authorities are analyzing DNA evidence left at the scene. Experts estimate the total value of the stolen items could reach up to £10 million. While there is a slim hope that the items may one day reappear, many in France feel deeply affected, viewing the theft as akin to the loss of the Mona Lisa — a profound cultural and emotional blow to national identity.
title: Where are the Louvre jewels now and can France get them back?
